name: Akanka
description: The Akanka is a medium-sized fey creature known for its chaotic nature and deceptive tactics. It possesses the ability to project an illusory duplicate of itself and utilizes a variety of spells to manipulate its surroundings.
memorable: Its ability to create illusory duplicates makes it a tricky opponent, capable of confounding its enemies in combat.
goals: Typically seeks to outsmart and manipulate its foes, preferring to engage in cunning tactics over straightforward combat.
relations: Can be encountered with other fey creatures or as a servant of a more powerful fey entity.
environment: Usually found in forested or mystical areas that complement its fey nature.
strengths: Possesses strong mobility with Spider Climb and can manipulate visuals to confuse opponents.
weaknesses: Reliance on visual abilities makes it vulnerable to enemies with blindsight or truesight.
attacks: Uses a multiattack strategy with a biting attack that can potentially incapacitate its target.
most_powerful_ability: Mirrored Carapace, which creates an illusory duplicate to confuse attackers.
spellcasting: Can cast illusion spells including Minor Illusion, Silent Image, Major Image, and Hallucinatory Terrain using Charisma as its spellcasting ability.
additional_information: Has the ability to ignore difficult terrain caused by webs with Web Walker.
Web Sense allows it to locate creatures in contact with the same web, giving it an advantage in ambush situations.
Can fall back on its unconscious condition immunity during a fight.
Charisma and Dexterity are its most notable attributes, enhancing both its spellcasting and agility.
Can project illusions that can significantly alter battlefield perception.
senses: Has passive Perception of 12, which is average.
skills: Lacks notable skill proficiencies, only has an average passive Perception.
